note.p: Clergyman and naturalist. BA, Cambridge, 1820. Ordained deacon, 1821; priest, 1824. Rector of Eccles, Norfolk, 1837–76. Member of the committee of the Norwich Museum from 1831; lectured frequently there on natural history. Wrote Observations on the fauna of Norfolk and was especially expert on birds of the region.
Transactions of the Norfolk and Norwich Naturalists’ Society 2 (1874–9): 292–306.
